definition.description: The location/region where the virtual network is created. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
Resource group name into which your new virtual machine will go.
Used to form various names including the key vault, vm, and storage. Must be unique.
Defines the Tier of storage account to be created. Valid options are Standard and Premium.
Defines the Replication Type to use for this storage account. Valid options include LRS, GRS etc.
The address prefix to use for the subnet.
Client ID of AAD app which has permissions to KeyVault
Client Secret of AAD app which has permissions to KeyVault

The base URI where artifacts required by this template are located. When the template is deployed using the accompanying scripts, a private location in the subscription will be used and this value will be automatically generated.
The sasToken required to access _artifactsLocation.  When the template is deployed using the accompanying scripts, a sasToken will be automatically generated.
EnableEncryption would encrypt the disks in place and EnableEncryptionFormat would format the disks directly
the name of the vm extension
URL of the KeyEncryptionKey used to encrypt the volume encryption key
name of Azure key vault resource
uri of Azure key vault resource
The passphrase for the disks
sequence version of the bitlocker operation. Increment this everytime an operation is performed on the same VM
Select kek if the secret should be encrypted with a key encryption key. Allowed values: kek, nokek
Defines which drives should be encrypted. OS encryption is supported on RHEL 7.2, CentOS 7.2 & Ubuntu 16.04. Allowed values: OS, Data, All
administrator password for the vm (recommended to disable password auth)
administrator user name for the vm
the name of the offer (az vm image list)
name of the publisher of the image (az vm image list)
image sku to apply (az vm image list)
version of the image to apply (az vm image list)
Specifies the size of the virtual machine. This must be the same as the vm image from which you are copying.
The address space that is used by the virtual network. You can supply more than one address space. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

The query string used to identify the disks to format and encrypt. This parameter only works when you set the EncryptionOperation as EnableEncryptionFormat. For example, passing [{"dev_path":"/dev/md0","name":"encryptedraid","file_system":"ext4"}] will format /dev/md0, encrypt it and mount it at /mnt/dataraid. This parameter should only be used for RAID devices. The specified device must not have any existing filesystem on it.
